==Other writings==
In Fragment II of ''[[The End of Bovadium]]''<ref name=CGL>[[Letter to Rayner Unwin (2 December 1968)]], quoted in {{CG|C}}, p. 737 (entry "2 December 1968")</ref>, it is mentioned that other cities besides ''[[Bovadium]]'' had been experiencing troubles from ''[[Motores Bi]]''; the '''Capital City''' is described as having "become an almost solid mass of ''Motores''". During the debates between the [[Northerners]] and the [[Southerners]], the Minister choose not to do anything proposed by either side and would have proceeded with his own plan had he not gotten trapped in the Capital City and died.<ref name="FII">{{TBF|II}}</ref>
